instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: MacBook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - SSD not detected
threads.message:
Hi,

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, powering on to flashing folder.

SSD not detected in disk utility and system info.

The board suffered liquid damage but was cleaned by another repair store.

These are the voltage I could measure.

<SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_L</SIGNAL> = 0v on <RESISTOR>R1431</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.34v on <RESISTOR>R9387</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PD_L</SIGNAL> = 3.31v on <RESISTOR>R9387</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.28v on <CHIP>U8650</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>STORAGE_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.31 on <RESISTOR>R9388</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>SSD_SR_EN_L</SIGNAL> = 3.38 on <RESISTOR>R1571</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PICCOLO_NOR_CS_L</SIGNAL> = 3.34v <RESISTOR>R9386</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PICCOLO_PID1</SIGNAL> = 3.34v <RESISTOR>R9381</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PICCOLO_PID0</SIGNAL> = 3.34v <RESISTOR>R9380</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PICCOLO_PGOOD</SIGNAL> = 0V on <RESISTOR>R9384</RESISTOR>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.34v ON SAME RESISTOR. <SIGNAL>PICCOLO_PGOOD</SIGNAL> resistance to GND about 37k varying.
<SIGNAL>PICCOLO_WP_L</SIGNAL> = 0v on <RESISTOR>R9385</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>STORAGE_LATCH</SIGNAL> = 3.17V on <DIODE>D8301</DIODE>

I Suspect <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_L</SIGNAL> but it is coming from PCH, <RESISTOR>R1431</RESISTOR> tested 95k

Any idea?

threads.title: MacBook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - SSD not detected
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

This should be CPU issue, one of classic problems on these boards.

"I Suspect <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_L</SIGNAL> = 0v"
Why, if is good?

You should check  <SIGNAL>SSD_SR_EN_L</SIGNAL>  on working board.

threads.title: MacBook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - SSD not detected
threads.message:
Hi 2informaticos,

Checked <SIGNAL>SSD_SR_EN_L</SIGNAL> on working board and it's 3.38v.

On <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> side of <RESISTOR>R9384</RESISTOR> 3.34v is present but on <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> side 0.01v.

When checked with power disconnected no short to GND and <RESISTOR>R9384</RESISTOR> read 37k.

I will replace <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> and check again.

threads.title: MacBook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - SSD not detected
threads.message:
is this solved already? i have the same problem onhand rightnow 

i did all this the same:
<SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN_L</SIGNAL> = 0v on <RESISTOR>R1431</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.34v on <RESISTOR>R9387</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PD_L</SIGNAL> = 3.31v on <RESISTOR>R9387</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.28v on <CHIP>U8650</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>STORAGE_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.31 on <RESISTOR>R9388</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>SSD_SR_EN_L</SIGNAL> = 3.38 on <RESISTOR>R1571</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PICCOLO_NOR_CS_L</SIGNAL> = 3.34v <RESISTOR>R9386</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PICCOLO_PID1</SIGNAL> = 3.34v <RESISTOR>R9381</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PICCOLO_PID0</SIGNAL> = 3.34v <RESISTOR>R9380</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>PICCOLO_PGOOD</SIGNAL> = 0V on <RESISTOR>R9384</RESISTOR>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.34v ON SAME RESISTOR. <SIGNAL>PICCOLO_PGOOD</SIGNAL> resistance to GND about 37k varying.
<SIGNAL>PICCOLO_WP_L</SIGNAL> = 0v on <RESISTOR>R9385</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>STORAGE_LATCH</SIGNAL> = 3.17V on <DIODE>D8301</DIODE>
 i reflow also the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> still the same problem
